newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest barley futures limit-down on crop outlook.
newsitem.headline: Budapest barley futures limit-down on crop outlook.

text.p: Barley futures prices on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) went limit-down on Wednesday, weighed down by a good harvest and cheap wheat, dealers said.
"Barley is still expensive compared with wheat," said Gabor Gyori of Order brokerage.
All barley futures dropped the daily allowed 400 forints per tonne to finish at between 17,800 forints for August and 20,800 forints for May.

Milling wheat futures were trendless, rising 10 forints for August to 19,860 and 150 forints for March to 22,130, while September eased 30 forints to 19,930 and December went down 150 to 20,710. Other milling wheat maturities remained flat.
Maize futures finished 100 to 370 forints per tonne lower for all but steady March, in relatively low turnover.

Total grains turnover on the BCE was 1,122 lots, slightly below Tuesday's 1,252 lots, but unusually high sunflower seed trade increased turnover in forint terms to 555 million forints from 522.66 million.
Sunflower seed rose 200 forints to 44,500 for November and closed at 44,700 for December, up 200.
